Question: Java: How to read a file line by line and store it in a string array? :I have a file that contains a list of names and their corresponding salaries. I want to read the file line by line and store the names and salaries in a string array. I have tried using BufferedReader and Scanner but I am not sure how to do it.
Please using this api: Scanner.nextLine.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Scanner.nextLine
<<<code>>>: String[] names = new String[10];
BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("names.txt"));
String line = br.readLine();
while (line != null) {
    names[i] = line;
    i++;
    line = br.readLine();
}
br.close();
System.out.println(Arrays.toString(names));
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Scanner class to read the file line by line. You can then store the lines in an array.
